column72: La grand Salle des ci-devant Soeurs noires
column76: This Gent sale titled Catalogue d'une belle collection de Livres...suivi d'une belle collection de Tableaux de differentes Ã‰coles consisted primarily of books, followed by 67 lots of paintings.  The majority of the paintings were by Flemish and Dutch artists, which is typical of Belgian sales in this period.  The painting descriptions are brief, with very few additional comments, and the subjects consisted primarily of landscape paintings and religious subjects.  While most of the prices for the books in the sale were recorded, the results for the paintings were not.  It should be noted that Lugt erroneously lists the auctioneer as Lavant rather than Lavaut.
